title: Firmware Update Instructions
content:
You can update Apollo II firmware directly from the dashboard.

Go to Dashboard → Settings → Firmware, upload the latest firmware file, and allow the process to complete. The unit will reboot automatically when finished.

If you are asking about flashing storage media instead, let me know before proceeding.

title: Node Sync Behavior (What’s Normal)
content:
During initial setup, node sync can take a significant amount of time and this is expected.

Please make sure your internet connection is stable, allow the unit to remain powered on, and avoid repeated reboots during sync.

If the sync appears stalled, a screenshot of the node status page will help confirm what’s happening.

title: Warranty Claim Information
content:
To review warranty options, please provide:
• Your order number
• A brief description of the issue
• Photos or screenshots showing the problem
• Current firmware version (if accessible)

Once we have this information, we can advise on next steps.

title: Shipping Status / Delays
content:

If you’d like me to check the latest status, please share your order number and I can review what information is available.

title: Request for More Information
content:
To help troubleshoot this accurately, please share:

title: Warranty Eligibility Review
content:
If you believe this may be a hardware issue, we can review warranty eligibility.

Please provide your order number, photos of the issue, and a short description of what’s happening so we can assess the situation.

title: Low or Zero Hashrate
content:
If your Apollo II is still syncing, mining may appear stalled or show low or zero hashrate. This is expected behavior during initial sync.

Mining will not behave normally until the node is fully synced. What sync percentage does the dashboard currently show?

title: Dashboard / Network Access Issues
content:
If apollo.local isn’t loading, try accessing the unit using its local IP address instead.

Make sure the miner and your device are on the same network, and restart the miner and router if needed.

Tools like Angry IP Scanner can help locate the unit on your local network.

title: Payment Verification
content:

Once confirmed, we can review order status.

title: Refund / Return Inquiry
content:
Refund and return eligibility depends on order status and delivery timing.

Please share your order number so we can review available options.

title: Mining Pool Configuration
content:
To configure pool mining on Apollo II:
1. Open Dashboard → Settings → Miner
2. Select Pool mode
3. Enter your pool’s stratum URL and worker name
4. Save settings and restart the miner

Most pools begin reporting hashrate within 10–15 minutes after connecting.

title: Solo Mining Overview
content:
Solo mining connects Apollo II directly to the Bitcoin network.

Block discovery is statistically rare, but a successful solo miner receives the full block reward.

For best results:
• Keep the node fully synced
• Leave the unit online continuously
• Avoid unnecessary reboots
